title: Shiny.rmd
code: renderPlot({   hist(faithful$eruptions, probability = TRUE,        breaks = as.numeric(input$n_breaks),        xlab = "Duration (minutes)",        main = "Geyser eruption duration")    dens <- density(faithful$eruptions, adjust = input$bw_adjust)   lines(dens, col = "blue") })

title: shiny2

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN. see vignette("test123", package = "test.package") information. see ?hello info function.
code: library(test.package) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

what: Aggregate tests by a grouping variable — aggregate_tests
title: Aggregate tests by a grouping variable — aggregate_tests
text: Counts test results grouping variable (Created Date, default) adds useful columns

title: Aggregate tests by a grouping variable — aggregate_tests
Aggregate tests by a grouping variable — aggregate_tests
text: data data.frame() tibble(). string matching one column names data; default  "Created Date".

title: Aggregate tests by a grouping variable — aggregate_tests
text: object type data, following columns added: n tests n results n positive % positive period output arranged ascending order variable identified argument; , arranged chronological order Created Date, default.
